column4: just to ask, but how can i connect to ubuntu 11.04 from windows 7's remote desktop connection
as in i have ssh access and i need to install AND configure
some way to access via remote desktop conn
you can use tightVNC from Windows and enable vino in Ubuntu
type vino-preferences
type it inside a gnome-terminal
ok; install vncserver on the remote machine
tightvncserver
man vncserver normally will set you on your way :)
just type vncserver it will guide you thro the configuration
ok now vncserver is up and on display 3
now you need to run a vnc client on the remote and select this server:3 to connect
typically 5901
netstat -l
did you specify display :3 ?
on your tightvnc client
just append :3
hang on: looking at screenshots in tightvnc.com site
oh; you need to attach an elastic IP
yep; but its free in the Lite tier
or you could just click on download as zip file
sudo lshw
